entries.s_ab68a343: It seems that Lt. Herm does not care for space flight. Apparently he's not fond of heights in general. As it turns out, when he signed on to be a pilot, he thought he could drive an AT-ST. I'm beginning to doubt that he could handle even that.
entries.s_a438c9: Yes, of course. Or something like that. But I'd rather avoid disciplinary action if possible. I believe that such actions reflect on me as a leader as well as on the person being disciplined. As such, I'm hopeful we can resolve this without Lt. Herm needing to be punished yet again.
entries.s_79729876: It is a military matter that is being handled. Of that, I assure you. The fact of the matter is that when the Empire tells one of its pilots to fly a patrol, then that pilot does so. Nothing else matters. I'm trying to convince Lt. Herm that it is best for him to remember that.
entries.s_757cddb8: Well, in theory, Lt. Herm here should be able to answer those kinds of questions, but I'm not so sure anymore.
entries.s_565b9394: As the flight officer for this base, my primary duties involve scheduling and overseeing Imperial TIE fighter patrols in the area. As such, I have little time for those such as yourself who are not involved with space flight.
entries.s_52b9f1df: Speaking of space flight, could you answer a few questions?
entries.s_485a7722: Yes, hello. I'm afraid I don't have time to chat. I must deal with this pilot, Lt. Herm, who is supposed to be on patrol.
entries.s_46c618ee: Maybe a few days of kitchen duty will help convince him.
entries.s_2d0b2b0d: Why doesn't he want to fly his patrol?
entries.s_2cc72ac: Could I ask some other questions?
entries.s_18f5467: I was wondering if you could answer some questions about flying?
entries.s_11a138a8: Good, an Imperial Pilot. Perhaps you could speak to Lt. Herm here and refresh his memory about what an honor it is to fly for the Empire.
entries.do_not_edit: The English version of this file (greeter_dantooine_imperial_officer.stf) is automatically generated by the SwgConversationEditor.
